properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Update 3: Due to a wildfire in the County of Northern Lights, a number of areas within the County must still be prepared to evacuate on short notice. Residents returning to the area north of Twin Lakes Campground including Keg River/Carcajou, to the Countyâ€™s north boundary, are advised that they also should be prepared to evacuate on short notice, should a change in the fire situation occur. ### Go to www.countyofnorthernlights.com for more update information and maps. Check www.wildfire.alberta.ca for up to date wildfire information. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-06-12T10:52:12-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of County of Northern Lights, 2019-06-05T10:50:52-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5809
Area: Northern Lights #22
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of County of Northern Lights

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rain expected along the Fundy coast on Thursday. A low pressure system near Lake Ontario is forecast to track eastward to cross Nova Scotia on Thursday. Rain at times heavy associated with this system will move into southern New Brunswick late tonight and then diminish to scattered showers on Thursday afternoon. At this time, total rainfall amounts are forecast to reach 35 to 45 millimetres along the Fundy coast. Should the track of the system move further to the north than expected, higher rainfall amounts are possible and rainfall warnings may be issued. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T09:24:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T01:25:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3162634133.2019
Area: Saint John and County, Grand Manan and Coastal Charlotte County, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke from wildfires in northern Alberta is causing locally poor air quality and reduced visibility. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-06T13:25:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-05T21:26:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0476020095.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rain expected across Nova Scotia on Thursday. A low pressure system near Lake Ontario is forecast to track eastward to cross Nova Scotia on Thursday. Rain at times heavy associated with this system will spread across the province late tonight into Thursday morning and then diminish to scattered showers on Thursday evening. Total rainfall amounts are generally expected to reach 30 to 40 millimetres, but some areas may receive amounts of 60 millimetres or more due to heavy showers embedded within the rain. Rainfall warnings have been issued for western Nova Scotia and it is possible that they will be extended to other regions as further information becomes available. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T09:23:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T01:24:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0946688441.2019
Area: Lunenburg County, Queens County, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County North, Hants County, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax Metro and Halifax County West, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost is expected overnight and early Thursday morning. Temperatures will drop to near or slightly below the zero degree mark tonight under clear skies and light winds. Temperatures will rise quickly after sunrise. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T18:03:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T02:04:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3554451827.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Kirkland Lake - Englehart

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are expected to move southeast of the area later this evening. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-06T09:01:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T00:44:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3286624742.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County, St. Thomas - Aylmer - Eastern Elgin County, Rodney - Shedden - Western Elgin County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms will continue to move southeast this evening. These thunderstorms have the potential to produce wind gusts up to 35 knots, reduced visibility in heavy rain and frequent lightning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-06-06T04:29:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T00:52:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2745390617.2019
Area: Western Lake Erie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A trough of low pressure tracking across the southern Prairies is triggering scattered thunderstorms over western Manitoba this afternoon. Some of these thunderstorms could become severe. The threat for severe weather will diminish this evening as the thunderstorms track eastwards and weaken. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T05:02:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-05T20:28:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0938553721.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A low pressure system near Lake Ontario is forecast to track eastward to cross Nova Scotia on Thursday. Rain at times heavy associated with this system will begin late overnight tonight and then diminish to scattered showers on Thursday evening. Total rainfall amounts are expected to reach 30 to 40 millimetres, with some areas likely to receive 60 millimetres or more due to heavy showers embedded within the rain. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-06T17:22:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-06T01:23:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3393312994.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. Winds are expected to become light tonight into early Thursday, possibly allowing smoke back into Pikangikum. Northwest winds Thursday should direct smoke away from Pikangikum for much of Thursday before winds become northeast Thursday night. Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-06T18:34:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-06T02:35:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0283307665.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario
